intro: Sclarea viridis, commonly known as green angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. Its aromatic foliage and historical use in traditional medicine highlight its botanical and cultural significance.
